bookData.title: To Kill a Mockingbird
bookData.author: Harper Lee
bookData.description: A gripping, heart-wrenching, and wholly remarkable tale of coming-of-age in a South poisoned by virulent prejudice, it views a world of great beauty and savage inequities through the eyes of a young girl.

bookData.author: George Orwell
bookData.description: A dystopian social science fiction novel that follows Winston Smith, a low-ranking member of 'the Party' in London, in the nation of Oceania, where the Party exercises total control over the inhabitants.

bookData.title: Pride and Prejudice
bookData.author: Jane Austen
bookData.description: A romantic novel of manners follows the character development of Elizabeth Bennet, the dynamic protagonist, who learns about the repercussions of hasty judgments.

bookData.title: The Catcher in the Rye
bookData.author: J.D. Salinger
bookData.description: The story of Holden Caulfield, a teenager from New York City who is expelled from his prep school and then takes a journey around his hometown.

bookData.title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
bookData.author: J.K. Rowling
bookData.description: The first novel in the Harry Potter series, following young Harry Potter as he discovers his magical heritage and attends Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.

bookData.title: The Lord of the Rings
bookData.author: J.R.R. Tolkien
bookData.description: An epic high-fantasy novel that follows the quest to destroy the One Ring and defeat the Dark Lord Sauron in Middle-earth.
